metadata.Title: CVE-2023-33203 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low
metadata.Description:
The Linux kernel before 6.2.9 has a race condition and resultantuse-after-free in drivers/net/ethernet/qualcomm/emac/emac.c if a physicallyproximate attacker unplugs an emac based device.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-33203` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-lowlatency - 4.4.0-2.16
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1094-kvm - 4.4.0-1004.9
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1129-aws - 4.4.0-1001.10
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in esm-infra/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-2.16').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-kvm package in esm-infra/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1004.9').
linux-aws package in esm-infra/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1001.10').
